snippet: A Senate bill that seeks to guard against the excesses of the past is fatally marred by two provisions buried in the text.
abstract: Editorial warns that bipartisan bill seeking to rejuvenate and safeguard the housing finance market is fatally marred by two hidden provisions; holds that flaws would shield mortgage-market participants from a broad range of transgressions, and would curb oversight of mortgage discrimination on racial, geographic and other grounds; demands provisions be struck from bill, which Senate Banking Committee is expected to vote on soon.
lead_paragraph: A Senate bill that seeks to guard against the excesses of the past is fatally marred by two provisions buried in the text.

headline.main: How to Fix the Mortgage Market
headline.print_headline: How to Fix the Mortgage Market

keywords.value: Federal Home Loan Mortgage Corp (Freddie Mac)
keywords.name: organizations
